definition: Qian Xuesen (1911-2009), Chinese scientist and aeronautical engineer
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Mr. Roger Tsien is the nephew of Doc. Qian Xuesen, the Father of Chinese missiles.
sentences.chinese: 錢永健是中國導彈之父錢學森的堂侄。

sentences.english: Roger Tsien is the nephew of Qian Xuesen, the Father of Chinese missiles.
sentences.chinese: 錢永健是中國導彈之父錢學森的堂侄。

sentences.english: The founding of human body science was proposed by Qian Xuesen in China.
sentences.chinese: 錢學森提出創建人體科學，這是科學上的大難題。

sentences.english: Qian, born in 1911, Han Hangzhou, Zhejiang Province.
sentences.chinese: 錢學森，1911年出生，漢族，浙江杭州人。

sentences.english: The 20-year stay of Qian Xuesen in America, he made profound preparations for him to serve the motherland worthily .
sentences.chinese: 錢學森在美國的20年爲他報效祖國做了充分的準備。

sentences.english: In 1955, Qian was allowed to return to China.
sentences.chinese: 1955年，錢學森終被允許返回中國。

sentences.english: In 1957, Qian was appointed president of the five branches.
sentences.chinese: 1957年，錢學森被任命爲五院院長。

sentences.english: Finally, in 1955, Qian was allowed to return to China.
sentences.chinese: 在1955年，錢學森終於被允許回中國。

sentences.english: Qian also participated in the Manhattan Project, which developed the first atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 錢學森還參與曼哈頓計劃，研發了第一顆原子彈。

sentences.english: Qian was greeted in China as a hero.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，錢學森被視爲英雄。

sentences.english: Qian was the son of a government official, born in the city of Hangzhou in the coastal  province of Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 錢學森原籍浙江杭州，生於官宦之家。

sentences.english: Qian died last week, at the age of ninety-eight.
sentences.chinese: 錢學森於上週過世，享年98歲。

sentences.english: His remarks came on the same day that Qian Xuesen passed away.
sentences.chinese: 他說這番話的同一天，錢學森去世。

sentences.english: You must talk about Qian Xuesen.

definition: Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Yanjing or Yenching University, Christian university in Beijing founded in 1919

definition: (China's achievements of) producing an atomic bomb (1964) and hydrogen bomb (1967) and launching a satellite into space (1970)

pinyin: Pu3 lin2 si1 dun4 Da4 xue2

definition: Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
